sentences.sContent: I refused the last but washed down the fruit and vegetables with clear, cold water from a hollowed gourd.
sentences.sContent_eng: I refused the last but washed down the fruit and vegetables with clear, cold water from a hollowed gourd.
sentences.sCn: 我没有动第三碗，只就着一只葫芦里干净的凉水，把水果和蔬菜风卷残云地吃了下去。

sentences.sContent: "I keep these stocks as my security, my backup, " he says, looking down at the gourd casks filled with what I now realize are seeds.
sentences.sContent_eng: "I keep these stocks as my security, my backup, " he says, looking down at the gourd casks filled with what I now realize are seeds.
sentences.sCn: “我保存这些存货作为我的保障，我的后备，”他一边说，一边低头觑着那些葫芦罐，我这才认出那里面装满的是种子。

sentences.sContent: The practice of carving and lighting the gourd is a Celtic custom brought to America by Irish immigrants, who used the more-plentiful turnip back home.
sentences.sContent_eng: The practice of carving and lighting the gourd is a Celtic custom brought to America by Irish immigrants, who used the more-plentiful turnip back home.
sentences.sCn: 在葫芦上刻鬼脸并作为灯笼的习俗最早来自于凯尔特民族，由爱尔兰移民传至美国，而美国人更常用芜菁。

trans.tranOther: a round fruit whose outer shell can be used as a container, or the container made from this fruit
